title: Food Track Order System
description: The Food Track Order System is a comprehensive mobile application designed to manage personal finances. It utilizes a robust tech stack that includes Handlebar for cross-platform development, NodeJs for backend services, and MongoDB for efficient database management. As a data-driven application, it offers users the ability to track expenses, set budgets, and receive personalized financial tips. The project emphasizes intuitive design and prioritizes data security to ensure a seamless user experience.

title: Quantitative Analysis of Yellow Taxi in NYC
description: I utilized applied data science techniques to analyze New York City taxi data, specifically focusing on the 2014-2017 Yellow Taxi Data. Using the big data analysis framework Spark, I handled large taxi data parquet files, processed and transformed the data into a human-readable format, and converted it into various graphic interpretations. I applied machine learning methods, such as linear modeling, to predict the trip cost and used clustering to discover traffic hotspots.

title: Personal Customer Relation Management (PCRM)
description: The PCRM project aims to develop a comprehensive customer relationship management system. It involves the use of Node.js, React.js, Express.js, CSS, HTML, and MongoDB to create a robust platform for managing customer interactions and data.

title: Digital Transformation
description: During my tenure at CSL, I held multifaceted roles as a Data Analyst, Scrum Master, and Team Leader. I combined analytical expertise with agile team management to ensure the timely and accurate delivery of project deliverables. My responsibilities included developing an experiment evaluation chart using advanced visualization tools, analyzing historical HPLC data, and applying unsupervised clustering algorithms to identify distinct data clusters. As a leader, I fostered collaborative environments, championed clear communication, and adhered to agile methodologies. My contributions exceeded supervisor expectations and facilitated digital transformation initiatives.

title: Cachex-AI
description: Cachex-AI is a project focused on implementing AI agents for the game of Cachex. This two-player connection game requires strategic thinking, anticipation, and sabotage. The project consists of two main parts: searching and competitive game agent. In the searching part, I implemented a heuristic and A* pathfinding algorithm to solve search-based problems on the Cachex game board. For the competitive game agent, I designed and implemented a program that plays the game competitively using various strategies.

title: Twitter Social Media Data Analysis
description: This project aims to create a parallelized program for the University of Melbourne’s HPC facility, SPARTAN, to effectively analyze a large Twitter dataset and achieve three data processing tasks. The report discusses the parallelization strategy using MPI via mpi4py and examines Amdahl’s Law’s impact on enhancing computational performance through parallelization and its consequences.

title: Australia Social Media Analytics on the Cloud
description: Our team successfully completed the "Australia Social Media Analytics on the Cloud" project, which involved leveraging Twitter data from the Australian Data Observatory (ADO), Mastodon APIs, and the Spatial Urban Data Observatory (SUDO) to gain valuable insights into life in Australia. By combining social media data with official data from the SUDO platform, we enhanced our understanding of various social trends and sentiments. The project encompassed data harvesting, processing, and analysis using cloud-based technologies. As a result, we developed a Social Sense Dashboard that provides actionable insights for decision-making.

title: Self-Driving Database Research
description: The Self-Driving Database Research project explores essential components of self-driving databases, with a focus on workload-driven optimization and index selection. These components are crucial for improving the performance of autonomous databases. By leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies, we aim to optimize resource allocation and query performance, ultimately reducing total ownership costs and relieving the burden on database administrators.

title: Machine Learning for Climate Change and Food Security
description: At the Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation (CSIRO), I gained extensive experience in data engineering and analysis. Working closely with Dr. Vassili Kitsios, I developed and maintained data pipelines to ensure reliable and timely availability of data for various analytical endeavors. My expertise in Python, Jupyter Notebook, and machine learning enabled me to comprehend complex data needs and deliver meticulously architected data solutions. I focused on optimizing data storage, retrieval, and processing mechanisms, which enhanced real-time analytics and facilitated research on food security and climate change.
